eEV9qn5WEOm3XFDpnffC5Q.text: This is one of the best places we've eaten at in Singapore. The food itself was great and the service was relatively quick considering there was quite a few people there. However it is not cheap, we paid $90 for 2 meals and 2 drinks. The alcohol was also expensive (not sure if it is just I'm used to it being cheap or not). I got the vegetable fajitas. It was a big serving and tasted delicious, I recommend.

JFFqnrxaFrEWe0tpL9WvOg.text: I hate complaining but this place kinda sucked entirely. We showed up, 5 of us, place didn't look busy whatsoever but were given an hour wait time. Fine, 40 mins later were offered space at the bar so decided to eat there. Long story short, we would've been better off at McDonald's. The food here was decent but so ridiculously priced. $200 for 5 of us. The bartenders had absolutely no urgency, I had to ask for the check 3 times and was never offered a refill or checked on how the food was, nothing. & lastly, the music totally sucked.

1pghktmtnClGU-d00wz04g.text: I don't often walk away from restaurants feeling annoyed, but tonight I did. I ordered a burger and instead they brought me a salad. I was hungry and didn't want to wait even longer, so I accepted the salad instead.I had to reorder a side of fries they hadn't brought out to me. At the end they tried charging me for the salad which was more expensive, even though I saved them money by not having them cook the burger I ordered. Over all I felt the staff didn't handle their mistake well and weren't apologetic in a

qLJsI0c_Wvj7MuLM4WTV_Q.text: 100% better than the HRC across the street from the Four Floors of Legitimate College Ladies Earning their Tuition.We ate here after a disappointing day in Sentosa (Tourist Trap AHHHH. Totally Waikiki but in Singapore. Stay. Away. Forever.) We try to eat at HRC any place we go and we'd already been to the one we shall not name, and decided to re-do our experience. The personality of the staff wasn't amazing, but they didn't seem to hate their jobs either, and that's nice.Our food was HOT. We got the jumbo platter in which we devoured all of it. It was clearly fresh and super delicious. I probably could have just eaten one of those.I got the satay burger, which was excellent, but I couldn't eat all of it. It was great and I would definitely recommend someone to to the HRC Sentosa if a typical HRC Experience is what they're looking for.I finally got my magnet, and a tee shirt :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe Sentosa - Singapore, Singapore

iFYBv3J8YFI5yYZD4ku3xg.text: One of those Hard Rock Cafes where you walk out thinking "why did I even go?" Overall we've had 4 different waitresses taking our orders etc. Gotta say neither one of them looked happy working there nor had any Hard Rock spirit. Had my Coke coming out 20 minutes after my partner had hers already. Food was okay but way too overpriced. Next time I'll just visit the Shop!

7fbx5fqmz4ggo9bG7tq8uw.text: Great place for lunch. Had the $15 set lunch soup, seabass, bottomless drink and dessert. Great value fresh fish. However the mini burgers are really mini

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe Sentosa - Singapore, Singapore

dRbiFLMtB4d1tvj1Odp9Qw.text: Everything you ever expect from a Hard Rock.  Autographed guitars, videos of Dio playing on the TV's, and a 8 page selection of cocktails. The hostess was nice.  I'm at the bar.  It's not very busy right now.  The beer is cold.  The restaurant is clean.  The prices are high - about S$19 for a basic burger, but in context of the location, it's probably average. This is just an expensive part of the world. I gave it 3 stars because it really is just average.  Nothing exceptional, nothing atrocious. If the guitars weren't on the wall and Dio not on TV, I could just as easily be at a TGI Fridays in Naperville Illinois.

FEftuFbKoW8OKIvwjpCnQw.text: The service is slow. We were :30 seconds away from walking out, just to place drink order. We were passed by tons of servers. Waited over 7 minutes for our check and a coke refill. Pathetic. I do not recommend for anyone.

9kaYvYLOR88vv7RWEJTf5A.text: I've known Hard Rock since I was a kid and always felt it was an overpriced commercial gimmick overplayed, but I'd have to say after looking for a solid place to park my flip flops, allow the kid and wife to refuel while I sample cocktails, this place still has rock n roll left in it.Ribs were monsterous for the price, and the cocktails are not watered down . Generous pours , and good sized glasses. This is a welcome retreat from the heat in Sentosa. Calling this my Sentosa Refuge... singapore sling, chaching!

UIwJtasWRk4Zht1CVAsNbw.text: I was with my wife and a friend. Starving and craving a burger, I thought it would be an easy meal at hard rock. My wife is vegetarian and the menu is relatively vege friendly which helped. Friend and I ordered classic burgers (medium and medium rare) while my wife ordered a kale salad. Everything was extremely salty, including the salad, and the burgers were clearly frozen patties that would never be able to achieve medium doneness. I admit we finished the food (as mentioned above, we were starving) Mentioned to the waiter that everything was super salty, even the salad, and he comes back to say that the kitchen says that we ordered a salty salad, which is bizarre to me. I understand the concept of supply and demand, especially on a tourist island, but I'm totally shocked that hard rock can't even get a burger right. Spend your money elsewhere.

doyPC0U7dCFUdJf1QGj4IQ.text: Popped in for a late lunch and got the $15 lunch set menu ... Was really nice, biggest decision was which main to get and the friendly waiter made my mind up for me. I'm not a big fish eater but thought I'd give it a try and it was nice. Bottomless drinks is great, especially if you're thirsty like I was. Soup was pretty average but for $15 what can you expect. Will go again. Set lunch menu is only available during the week from 11am-3pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Hard Rock Cafe Sentosa - Singapore, Singapore. Bottomless drinks
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe Sentosa - Singapore, Singapore. 3rd course of set menu
Photo of Hard Rock Cafe Sentosa - Singapore, Singapore. Second course of set menu

sW9YUYA5MrLqLolonDSUkw.text: Very friendly and helpful service. This cafe is not yet participating the the new Hard Rock Rewards Program. No AAA discount.

ubaxGCId3Bi5rWIxCwxSNA.text: I'm a regular at most Hard Rock Cafe's around the world. This one was a little bit old or at least it felt like it. But you get everything a hard rock has. Okay food, cold beer and great ambience.  My service was pretty decent so that's why I gave it a three star.

DoGuj0gStWD8x6WUJKS8Kg.text: Going to Hard Rock Cafe almost makes me feel like a tourist, even if it is simply in Sentosa. Hard Rock Cafe has been on Earth for as long as I can remember and I enjoy trying out the Hard Rock Cafes in the different countries I visit. Awhile ago, a friend from school decided to visit me in Singapore and as she was a tourist and I felt like being one, we went to Hard Rock Cafe for dinner. It is not very different in design from other Hard Rock Cafes. It is dark inside with a bar area and loud music. Apparently there is live music on some nights, but there wasn't any the night we went. The food though was very different. Serving sizes are definitely smaller than those overseas, or at least those that I'd been to. We ordered the Hickory smoked Bar-B-Que Combo with ribs, chicken and smoked pulled pork since we couldn't make up our minds. It was beyond disappointing when we took our first bites and the meat was dry. The BBQ ribs were covered with a thick layer of sauce but the flavour had not even begun to enter the meat. I've had much more appetizing smoked pulled pork and the overall look of the dish was all the more unappetizing. The food looked like it had simply been thrown on the crowded plate and the sauces mixed with each other. Perhaps it is because I had expected much more from Hard Rock Cafe that has led to such disappointment. We decided to round off our meal with cocktails. It was the first cocktail my friend has ever had and she said that she probably would not have another one again. Given the rather expensive prices, I probably would not visit this Hard Rock Cafe again especially since I can get better American food elsewhere.
